sentences.en: Bradley will go down in history as Los Angeles' longest serving mayor.
sentences.cn: 布拉德利将作为洛杉矶任期最长的市长被载入史册。

sentences.en: For his dedication the Mayor awarded him a medal of merit.
sentences.cn: 为表彰他的奉献精神，市长授予他荣誉奖章。

sentences.en: He cajoled Mr Dobson to stand for mayor.
sentences.cn: 他说服多布森先生竞选市长。

sentences.en: Her maternal grandfather was Mayor of Karachi.
sentences.cn: 她的外公是卡拉奇市的市长。

sentences.en: In 1966, Pastor Albertz took over from him as governing mayor.
sentences.cn: 1966年，帕斯特·艾伯茨接替他担任主管市长。

sentences.en: Many small town mayor and city official practice cronyism.
sentences.cn: 许多小镇的市长和大城市的官员都有任人唯亲的行为.

sentences.en: My uncle was the mayor of Memphis.
sentences.cn: 我伯父是孟菲斯市市长。

sentences.en: The city council is presided over by the mayor.
the election of the London mayor
The Lord Mayor follows at the rear in his gilded coach.
sentences.cn: 市长大人坐在他阔气的马车里在后面跟着。

sentences.en: The malleable mayor of New York was under his control.
sentences.cn: 这位听话的纽约市市长听命于他。

sentences.en: The mayor hurried into his office, brushing off the reporters.
sentences.cn: 市长赶快走进办公室, 拒不接见记者.

sentences.en: The Mayor kicked off the party.
The mayor's scheme offers incentives to firms setting up in lower Manhattan.
sentences.cn: 市长的方案激励了打算在曼哈顿下城开业的公司。

sentences.en: The new mayor said he would clean the city up.
sentences.cn: 新市长说,他要整顿本市.

trans.tran_en: the person who has been elected to lead the government of a town or city
